_comment: Created by ianb on 01/10/2014 11:57:29 using v2.1
title: How have the numbers of nurses in psychiatric services changed?
analysis_commentary: There has been a steady decline in the number of non-community psychiatric nurses between September 2009 and May 2014, from 26,299 to 22,750; this represents a 13.5% decrease. The number of community psychiatric nurses has remained steady, suggesting that the non-community nurses have left the workforce.
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, NHS Hospital & Community Health Service Workforce Statistics
